description: From Middle French caparaçon, from Old Spanish caparazón, from Old Occitan capairon.

entries.meaning: The often ornamental coverings for an animal, especially a horse or an elephant.

verbs.description: caparison (third-person singular simple present caparisons, present participle caparisoning, simple past and past participle caparisoned)

entries.meaning: To dress up a horse or elephant with ornamental coverings.
examples: Come, bustle, bustle; caparison my horse
